intro: Dactylocardamum polyspermum, commonly known as the mountain cardamom, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Zingiberaceae, which includes other economically important spices like ginger and cardamom. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of compact clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
